choices.C: Reset the discover hello hold time and interval to their default values.
choices.B: Enable the mpls ip command on RC interface Gi2/0.
choices.D: Configure the mpls ldp router-id loopback0 command on RA and RC.
choices.A: Implement LDP session protection on RA.

discussion.content:
RA needs to create a neighborship by using RC's loopback for LDP. RA does not have any route to RC's loopback via CEF table. 

Answers does not make sense to me. 

B -- i would think this is the answer as well, as we don't even see RA receiving any LDP hellos -- 

D -- ww don't need router-id lo0 on RA as the question does not ask for it. Question is only asking C to use the loopback. 

Because we don't receive any hellos from RC, we have to assume mpls ip is not configured on that interface. Therefore, making the answer B.
d is correct as he request ldp router is loopback and ldp backet router id are sent by ip of interface

Selected Answer: B
B is correct

choices.C: to reuse router resources for other reservation requests
choices.B: to confirm successful end-to-end resource allocation

choices.A: to inform the headend router of LSP issues

questions.question_text: A customer site is being connected to a Frame Relay network via a T1 link. The customer has a contract for 512 kbps service with a Tc value of 125 ms. Under peak line conditions customer traffic can reach four times the contracted speed. Which QoS configuration must the service provider implement to limit the customer to the contracted values?

//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. Which show command shows statistics for the control plane policy and is used to troubleshoot?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
"D" seems to be correct: https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/lan/catalyst6500/ios/15-3SY/config_guide/sup6T/15_3_sy_swcg_6T/control_plane_policing_copp.pdf
D is correct I've tested that in my LAB

choices.B: Implement traffic shaping to delay noncritical traffic when the link is congested.
choices.C: Implement strict priority to guarantee bandwidth for the server traffic.
choices.D: Implement FIFO to guarantee that the server traffic is sent first while other traffic is queued.
choices.A: Implement policing to rate-limit noncritical traffic that exceeds designated thresholds.

discussion.content: i think c is correct because b mean u will keep in buffer the non traffic and he request bw for server traffic

Selected Answer: C
Apologies "C" -- " With other traffic being dropped"

comments.content: I would say "B" is a better solution but the "with other traffic being drop" make me think we should go with "C"

discussion.content: B seems more like the answer for me --> shaping using CBWFQ or LLQ

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. A host connected to R3 must connect with a server on R1 that provides critical, time-sensitive data. Traffic between the host and server must always be given bandwidth to traverse the links when they are congested, with other traffic being dropped. How must the network engineer implement a QoS strategy with classification to ensure that the traffic is given the appropriate bandwidth?
